title: SOLD--Two H-o-F, 2 SL, P to F-G--
author: dougscats

posts.post_title: SOLD--Two H-o-F, 2 SL, P to F-G--
posts.post_content:
ALL SOLD--Two H-o-F and 2 SL for $136, delivered. If you want an individual card/cards, let me know and I'll give you a price. First taker gets it. 

Most forms of payment okay. If paypal, pay as friend; thanks.

I am always looking to upgrade [Good or better], so if you're interested in trading please send me a list of what you have. I prefer ungraded cards.

No pm's, please. Email [url]djdoremus@msn.com[/url], or post here.

KELLEY, 
CRAWFORD [F-G?--has some slight creasing, some that doesn't break the paper]--SOLD--
WILLIS batting--SOLD-- 
WILLIS pitching--SOLD-- 
Chase, dark hat, Sovereign [has very fine, unusual[?], red printer's mark in right-hand border, a bit of wet-sheet transfer-shadow on back. Small ink[?] mark on bottom border]--moved to a separate thread-- 
DUFFY--SOLD-- 
COLLINS, Minn [card has some nice attributes--no apparent creases, pretty sharp corners--but has an ink[?] mark in front and much paper-loss in back],

SL'ers:
Cranston, Memphis--SOLD--   
Miller, Dallas [note spot of paper-loss on belt],
Lipe, Richmond--SOLD--  
Howard, Savannah

*Note on Scans: As the page is turned, the backs are in opposite order. Also, the cards are in two protective plastics, a halved penny-sleeve--which creates the appearance of a vertical line on each card--and a pocket-page:

PM Sent on the Crawford and the 2 Willis's.

Matt

Email sent on Duffy as well.

Matt
Email sent on Cranston and Lipe.
